website_summaries.verdict: A classic drive that maintains a rugged look and feel, but may disappoint long term users.
pros: The device syncs quickly and transfers runs surprisingly smooth
A thick rubber strip keeps the hardware secure, easy to hold, and protected even after a few drops
cons: The drive is a bit bulky and users complain of cable connectivity issues that seem to get worse over time

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! It was plug and go -- the Firewire makes it fast. Looks, feels and functions solid. I like the energy saving mode where it slows the fan(?) when the drive is on idle for awhile and it doesnʻt get hot. Unlike some others where the device starts to get really hot even with the fan on when connected for a long period. Worth its cost. One point, though, be sure to write down the serial number thatʻs on the box... before throwing it away. You will not find it on the device when you register it, unless you open the casing, which would break your manufacturerʻs warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson A

customer_reviews.title: Words will with Apple 2010 iMAC through Firewire 800 Port and Time Machine software
customer_reviews.text: PRO Comes with both Firewire and USB cables Words well with Time Machine on my 2010 iMAC computer CON Had to reform the drive to ensure ease of use with Apple OS Instructions lacking (Non provided outside warranted information and labeling on box) Summary Works well as a back up external drive plugged into the iMAC firewire 800 port.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: When I had an old MacBook Pro, I had to transfer a lot of data from my hard drive to an external. USB 2.0 is fine, but I needed *anything* that was quicker. FireWire was the only choice I had, and with the secondary USB 3.0 port, this was good for looking into a future computer with faster transfer speeds. Like any external drive, be sure to keep it cool when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Would have liked an indicator light to ensure drive is running. Software useless for a Mac environment.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for an older Mac. FireWire 800 connection. The software was useless. I eventually reformatted the drive and just use it with Mac’s default back up routine. So the drive works in that regard. I can also partition it, but the software was clunky and would not work with the Mac. I did not like the process for choosing back up files. It’s clearly geared more to PC users.
customer_reviews.author: HedgehogMissesFl

customer_reviews.title: Great drive.
customer_reviews.text: LaCie has never disappointed me. Easy "plug and play". I keep a backup drive at home, so this rugged drive let's me take everything with me. Also a great price. Just bought a 1T drive to keep ONLY as a bootable clone in case of computer issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. I had a problem when I messed up partitioning it, but LaCie's customer service helped me through it. UPDATE 4/10/18: I had a more serious problem, most likely of my own doing or my computer's doing, contacted Customer Service via email and awaited their response. Within a day, I had a response with various trouble-shooting suggestions in my inbox. The problem was fixed! These guys and gals are good!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Drive failure at just 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Drive worked flawlessly for two weeks and then decided it just wouldn't mount any longer. I have some precious data on it now because it waited until I'd finished a project but not until I'd backed it up before it failed. Not sure what to do at the moment but wiping it and reformatting is probably in its future. So, as a storage device, it sucks no matter the price or capacity because it died. I may have had as much as .5GB on it at most when it gave out.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: As a professional video editor, one might expect that I would be pretty tech savvy. Big mistake. I give this drive only 3 stars not because it doesn't provide great storage. It does. But it needs to spin much faster to provide smooth video. The rpm of the disc should be in the initial description. So it's somewhat amazons mistake, but mostly mine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Harris

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Paperweight - Died after 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as a system backup drive. After 30 days, it died. Tried to reformat, but can't even do that. Initial error message indicated it is "read only", so supposedly files stored to date could be accessed. That would work if the system would recognize it, but it doesn't do that either. It's now an overpriced paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: OneSeaSun4Fun

customer_reviews.title: Vendor was great
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a great product. I just happened to buy the one that failed. And I highly suspect it was the third party back up software that crashed this disk - unrecoverable for the average user (like me). Vendor was great about the return. No cost to me.
customer_reviews.author: BRP

customer_reviews.title: FireWire 800,  For older Macs it’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great little back up drive. Especially if for the old Mac’s that use FireWire 800
customer_reviews.author: Tovarizer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stable hard drive. I use this to keep all my photographs on it and it's wonderful and smooth. I have an older Seagate hard drive, and the LaCie is faster and so much smoother than my other hard drives that I bought. I definitely think it's worth the extra money for this.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine S.

customer_reviews.title: ... a LaCie drive and the rugged models are my favorite. I have an older version plugged in at ...
customer_reviews.text: Knock on wood I’ve never had a proble with a LaCie drive and the rugged models are my favorite. I have an older version plugged in at this moment and it’s at least 3 years old and it’s still humming along.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha

customer_reviews.title: Always wonderful! No problems
customer_reviews.text: I have almost always used these LaCie Rugged drives with my MacBook Pro. They are reliable and work fine, have been for years. I did buy another less expensive drive recently but it has a rather annoying blinking light, oh well, as long as it keeps working. I am using that one as a back up for a back up.
customer_reviews.author: P H F

customer_reviews.title: Brick after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Disk errors 3 times in 4 months. First two repairable, third time a brick. Used only as time capsule backup. Never moved from desk.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pluribus Unum

customer_reviews.title: All good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple installation on my Mac using very easy software. Installed and have used daily for a couple months now. Zero problems thus far.
customer_reviews.author: WilburPost

customer_reviews.title: Good drive good price
customer_reviews.text: Using for video editing and transfering files on 2010 macbook pro and 5.1 mac pro.Not as fast as my g-speeds, but the price was good and accomplishes the mission.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find a decent firewire drive anymore, this ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a decent firewire drive anymore, this has been working well on my legacy Macs and has USB if I need to go to the PCJust be sure to reformat as EXFAT first.
customer_reviews.author: The Digital Dean

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!!! Needed to expand my memory for my mac. This cutie did the trick. Love the fact that it's lightweight and rather fast to access the drive. Rugged and my kids can't break it, yeah!! 5 stars for you.
customer_reviews.author: JpO

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Great because they hold 2TB and they can be piggy backed (chain connected!)
customer_reviews.author: Rachael R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative for MacBook Pro (2012) when Thunderbolt is tied up for second monitor
customer_reviews.author: Keith Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: I liked the last one so I bought another. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Misch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works good on My iMac firewire connection going to use on as backup
customer_reviews.author: ben bruns

customer_reviews.title: Don't get a 7200 RPM hard drive like this if you don't need the speed
customer_reviews.text: Fast, reliable hard drives. Don't get a 7200 RPM hard drive like this if you don't need the speed. The speed is only good if you want to edit films from the hard drive or play games directly off of it. Other than that, you can buy a cheaper 5400 RPM Lacie which is good for watching films, transferring files and everything else basically.
customer_reviews.author: Henna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Small, fast and durable. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: James J. Coddington

customer_reviews.title: High capacity, light weight, powered from laptop, for back-up.
customer_reviews.text: Previous similar hard drive lasted for 3 years, three trips across the country, before it failed and could not be re-formatted.
customer_reviews.author: Ogunquit

customer_reviews.title: Transfer data from old MacBook Pro TimeMachine bkup with FireWire to newer computer
customer_reviews.text: Hey - you need two dongles ($85) to connect FireWire 800 to Thunderbolt 3. No brainer. Worked great - no messing around.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed exactly 3 months after purchase and it appears is outside the return window. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: zoe bower

customer_reviews.title: The drives are in rotation and work great! All praise Firewire800
customer_reviews.text: Packed and shipped well. The drives are in rotation and work great! All praise Firewire800!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive!
customer_reviews.text: I liked all the features and apps available to LaCie drive. The specs were true to what were specified. I haven’t used tech support yet, that’s the reason for the rate.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher j Savage

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels very strong and able to withstand being in my backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: its good
customer_reviews.text: it's small, it works, the orange stuff is looser on it than you think and you could take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Arguably Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best product for storing ram. I have like 6 of them
customer_reviews.author: M. Schembri

customer_reviews.title: Good Price. Great Product, Size & Portability.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these before, needed this larger storage capacity for backing up. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Max Headroom

customer_reviews.title: Firewire 800 took 5.5 hrs to back up 875 gb from Macbook Air Mid 2011
customer_reviews.text: I opened the item and proceeded to connect it to my mid 2011 Macbook Air with 1tb ssd via thunderbolt with the firewire 800 converter and started to backup 875 gb of information and the Time Machine said approximately 12 then 14 hours I was ok with that. But after 3 hours it said I have 4 hours left!!! I started back up at 1445 hrs and it got done at 2015hrs about 5hrs and 30 min to back up 875 gb of information not bad....Very happy so far. I have bought Lacie products for my Apple products since 2008/2009 (2 little big disk, 2 rugged) and have been happy with them all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Serna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the product and it seems to be holding up as it should have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this primarily so I can use it with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily so I can use it with the FireWire interface on my MacBook. I use it as a backup drive. It takes longer to mount then some other drives.
customer_reviews.author: Armin A. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Great backup
customer_reviews.text: My son installed it but I think I could have done it. Seemed simple. It has been working great. Nice size.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

product_meta.title: LaCie Rugged Triple 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD – USB 3.0 FireWire 800 compatible for Mac and PC Computer Desktop Workstation Laptop (LAC9000448)
product_meta.description: Perfect for storing 2TB of content, Rugged Triple is the easy way to connect to FireWire 800 and USB 3.0 computers. This ultra-tough external hard drive features dual FireWire ports for daisy chaining and a USB 3.0 port for speed transfers of up to 110MB/s. Trek any terrain confidently with drop, dust, and water resistance and take advantage of a complimentary one-month membership to the Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps Plan for access to awesome photo and video editing apps. Plus—enjoy long-term peace of mind with the included two-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Perfect for storing up to 2TB of content, Rugged Triple external hard drive is the easy way to connect to FireWire 800 and USB 3.0 computers
For those who have a need for speed, this portable hard drive features dual FireWire ports for daisy chaining and a USB 3.0 port for speed transfers of up to 110MB/s
Trek any terrain confidently with a portable external hard drive that offers all-terrain durability of drop, dust, and water resistance
Take advantage of a complimentary one-month membership to the Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps Plan for access to awesome photo and video editing apps
Enjoy long-term peace of mind with the included two-year limited warranty
